title: Art and motion
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Paul Burnford Productions and Paul Burnford
brief_description: Demonstrates the relationships between movement in nature, in space-time concepts, and in abstract art forms. Shows the relationship between space and motion in the mobiles of Calder and Usher, in the paintings of Balla, Kadinsky and Van Gogh, and in the abstract film “Colour Fragments” by Elwood Decker.
